name: 600th Anniversary of Swiss Confederation
obverse: Three men taking an oath together.
obverse_inscriptions: WIR WOLLEN SEIN EIN EINIG VOLK VON BRÜDERN, IN KEINER NOTH UNS TRENNEN UND GEFAHR
reverse: A tree showing its roots. Three coat of arms are at the base of the tree: Uri, Schwyz, Unterwalden. A scroll around the base of the tree has the year 1291. In the middle of the tree, surrounded a wreath of oak, is the coat of arms of Switzerland with the year 1891 above. The tree has twenty-two branches representing the cantons of Switzerland. The branches are arranged (from left to right) in the official order: Zurich, Bern, Luzern, Uri, Schwyz, Unterwalden, Glarus, Zug, Fribourg, Solothurn, Basel, Schaffhausen, Appenzell, St. Gallen, Graubünden, Aargau, Thurgau, Ticino, Vaud, Valais, Neuchâtel, Geneva.
reverse_inscriptions: ZUR ERINNERUNG DES ERSTEN BUNDES AN DIE DER VI. SÄKULARFEIER EIDGENOSSEN 1. AUGUST 1891
references: Les médailles du sixième Centenaire de l'Alliance Helvétique #4
description: This medal was made to commemorate the 600th anniversary of the beginning of the Swiss Confederation.
